snippet: A reporter went to Prospect Park seeking to measure the speed of anything that moved, from footballs to sea lions.
abstract: New York Times reporter Andy Newman tests a radar gun, similar to those used by police to measure speeding vehicles, in Brooklyn's Prospect Park; outing proves what any traffic-ticket lawyer would say--there are many factors that can affect accuracy of radar technology.
lead_paragraph: A reporter went to Prospect Park seeking to measure the speed of anything that moved, from footballs to sea lions.

headline.main: Speed Gun in Hand, Everything’s a Target
headline.print_headline: Our Radar’s Aim Was True. The Results, Not So Much.
